intro: Lanium microphyllum subsp. colombianum, commonly known as the Colombian small-leaved lanium, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Colombia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
